sections.title: Generating Functions for $N_A^p(n)$ and $N_A^q(n)$, and Six ways to Convolution and Recurrence Identities
Asymptotic Estimate of $N_A^p(n)$ when $A$ is a Finite Set

theorem_statement:
\label{iden-2} Let $n$ be a positive integer and let $A$ be a set of positive integers. We have
(a)  \[ \sum_{k=1}^{n}N^p_A(k)\left(q_A^e(n-k)-q_A^o(n-k)\right)=\tau_A(n), \]
(b)  \[ \sum_{k=1}^nN^q_A(k)\left(p_A^e(n-k)-p_A^o(n-k)\right)=\tau_A^s(n). \]
generated_proof:
We assume throughout that A ⊆ ℕ is a (finite or infinite) set of allowed parts for partitions, and we work with formal power series.

Definitions:
- p_A(n): number of partitions of n into parts from A, unrestricted multiplicity.
- q_A(n): number of partitions of n into distinct parts from A.
- p_A^e(n), p_A^o(n): numbers of such unrestricted partitions with an even, respectively odd, number of parts.
- q_A^e(n), q_A^o(n): numbers of such distinct-part partitions with an even, respectively odd, number of parts.
- N_A^p(n): total number of parts among all unrestricted A-partitions of n.
- N_A^q(n): total number of parts among all distinct A-partitions of n.
- τ_A(n): number of divisors of n that lie in A, i.e., τ_A(n) = |{a ∈ A : a | n}|.
- τ_A^s(n): signed A-divisor function τ_A^s(n) = ∑_{a∈A, a|n} (-1)^{n/a - 1}.

We use the following generating functions:
- Unrestricted partitions: P_A(x) = ∑_{n≥0} p_A(n) x^n = ∏_{a∈A} (1 - x^a)^{-1}.
- Distinct partitions: Q_A(x) = ∑_{n≥0} q_A(n) x^n = ∏_{a∈A} (1 + x^a).
- Parity refinements:
  ∑_{n≥0} (q_A^e(n) - q_A^o(n)) x^n = ∏_{a∈A} (1 - x^a),
  ∑_{n≥0} (p_A^e(n) - p_A^o(n)) x^n = ∏_{a∈A} (1 + x^a)^{-1}.
- Divisor series:
  ∑_{n≥1} τ_A(n) x^n = ∑_{a∈A} x^a/(1 - x^a) = ∑_{a∈A} ∑_{m≥1} x^{ma},
  ∑_{n≥1} τ_A^s(n) x^n = ∑_{a∈A} x^a/(1 + x^a) = ∑_{a∈A} ∑_{m≥1} (-1)^{m-1} x^{ma}.

Lemma 1 (Total parts generating functions).
(i) ∑_{n≥1} N_A^p(n) x^n = P_A(x) · ∑_{a∈A} x^a/(1 - x^a).
(ii) ∑_{n≥1} N_A^q(n) x^n = Q_A(x) · ∑_{a∈A} x^a/(1 + x^a).

Proof of Lemma 1.
Introduce independent marks u_a for each a ∈ A.

For unrestricted partitions:
M(x; (u_a)) = ∏_{a∈A} (1 - u_a x^a)^{-1}.
Then u_b ∂/∂u_b M = [x^b/(1 - u_b x^b)] · ∏_{a≠b} (1 - u_a x^a)^{-1}.
Setting all u_a = 1 and summing over b gives
∑_{n≥0} N_A^p(n) x^n = P_A(x) · ∑_{b∈A} x^b/(1 - x^b).
Since N_A^p(0) = 0, the series starts at n = 1.

For distinct partitions:
M_dist(x; (u_a)) = ∏_{a∈A} (1 + u_a x^a).
Then u_b ∂/∂u_b M_dist = [u_b x^b] · ∏_{a≠b} (1 + u_a x^a).
Setting u_a = 1 yields x^b · ∏_{a≠b} (1 + x^a) = Q_A(x) · x^b/(1 + x^b).
Summing over b proves (ii). ∎

Proof of Theorem.
(a) Consider the product of generating functions
(∑_{n≥1} N_A^p(n) x^n) · (∑_{m≥0} (q_A^e(m) - q_A^o(m)) x^m).
By Lemma 1(i) and the parity GF for
